abstract: A federal jury sides with former sales representatives who said the pharmaceutical company discriminated against them in pay and promotions.
snippet: A federal jury sides with former sales representatives who said the pharmaceutical company discriminated against them in pay and promotions.
lead_paragraph: A federal jury in New York reached a verdict on Monday requiring Novartis Pharmaceuticals to pay $3.36 million to 12 former female sales representatives for discrimination in pay and promotions.

headline.main: Women Win a Bias Suit Against Novartis
headline.print_headline: Women Win A Bias Suit Against Novartis
